why he left him back guarding the shuttle. Perhaps he should have had

tronger door or better locks installed. As he was considering what

he felt a hand on his shoulder and he saw WINGSABER, his old

riend.

s."
> WINGSABER's words were warm and encouraging. "Think of this as a

allenge to be overcome."

 walked over towards TUSCON, RODIMUS, WHEELIE and the now

 "Gentle-mechs." he said, his voice clear and
> authoratative. It was the v=
oice of one who had spent many years

one who had to bring many youths

WHEELIE, "Is this how Maximals act?

ach other with words." Looking

ht of 'peace

<NEW - Wheelie>

Wheelie merely glanced back at Tus=
con's friends, "You know, they seem to value you a great deal.  But don't l=
et them blind you to the better meal.  They will watch your back within a f=
ray, but cover your flaws for another day.  To thine own self thy must be t=
rue.  But do not make them eternally watch over you.  For your weakness the=
y cover, but you cannot expect it to eternially hover."

Then folding back =
his arms, and glancing up at Leo Prime, "And yet here you say, we have a bu=
nch of ninnies who run every what which way."  Wheelie's chimes grew in mel=
ody, "Funny, peace often comes through a gunny.  Look at when the Autobots =
were around, the corrupt little councril ran things into the ground.  So so=
metimes peace comes through a gun.  Tell that to Grimlock, I bet you'll hav=
e fun."

Continuing, "And look at us here, how many vorns after het war.  S=
parring in the past, to prevent another score.  IF this is what we're all a=
bout, I'd rather have my gun ready and out.  Because if we're about to go i=
nto another fray, I'd rather be ready than always at play.  Because peace n=
ever seems to come, just the time to fix your gun.  We'll always be ready, =
we'll always have to fight, for evil and darkness will never go gentle into=
 that good night.  For evil wins, and terror finds, when those who are good=
 do not watch or mind.  For Autobots, Maximals, whatever we be, the war sha=
ll always twist to thee."
